Of course, honey! To isolate "x" in the equation 2x + 3 = 9, we first need to get rid of the "+ 3" on the left side. We can do this by subtracting 3 from both sides of the equation. This gives us:

2x = 9 - 3
2x = 6

Then, to solve for "x", we need to divide both sides of the equation by 2. So:

x = 6 / 2
x = 3
